text: The credit union was hacked on December 6, 2018, I was contacted that “my” debit card was flagged for fraud alert. Was informed by a representative for the Calvert, AL Brach that I would receive a card 10 days from December 6, 2018. It is now December 19, 2018. Still no debit card. I began calling the credit union on December 11th. Was informed my card has been shipped, I’ve called every day since, only to be on hold long periods of time never get a callback. So I keep calling only to be told sorry for the delay all our members had to get new cards and we are just protecting your account and I appreciate that. I don’t have credit cards all I have is a debit card. called the following day because I still have no card was told we can expedite you a card for $40 but that still not overnight shipping. I am slated to board a flight December 22, 2018, for a trip I’ve planned all year for Christmas I can not pay for a hotel room, checked back or my Broadway show with a check or cash. I know and feel I am not being valued or treated as a priority as a customer or member of this credit union for the error(s). I wasn't even given the option to have a new card expedited with fees waived due to my inconvenience. This credit union sucks I wouldn’t recommend them to the hackers who started this mess, yet alone Satan Himself.

The feature is meant to ensure that you reach an employee in a timely manner, but there is always room for improvement! I'll share this with our IT Manager right away. We appreciate your membership, and hope to exceed your expectations any time you call or visit! Hope to see you soon!

name: Mattie Williams
text: To slow, you have to wait to long to be served and they always closing down sites making it an inconvenience.

resp.text: Dear Ms. Williams: Thank you for your review. New Horizons Credit Union certainly apologizes for the inconvenience. Unfortunately, we've been hit hard by the pandemic and have limited staff as a result, and we're aware this affects our members. We aren't always closing down sites as you stated, but rather trying to modify operations so we can continue to serve our members at major locations, which may be going to drive-thru only or appointments only due to limited staff. This is for the safety of both our members and staff. Yes, we have been modifying operations, but we are notifying members the best we can during these challenging times. To avoid these long wait times and inconveniences, we have been encouraging our members to enroll in Online Banking and download our free Mobile App. Both Online Banking and our Mobile App offer Bill Pay that easily allows you pay bills and send money to friends and family, Remote Check Deposit that lets you easily deposit checks from anywhere at any time, and you can check your balance and easily transfer money between accounts if you enroll in Online Banking. You can call our Member Services center or visit our website to easily enroll in these services. If you need to speak to a representative at branch face to face, we encourage you to make an appointment on our website to avoid long wait times. Again, we certainly apologize for the inconvenience and we appreciate your patience. If there is anything else we can assist you with, please feel free to call us at (251) 316-3240 or email us at marketing@newhcu.org.

name: TreMaine Thrash
text: Despite the wait due to this pandemic the workers deserve a raise and unconditional benefits from their employer. They are hard working friend and very very helpful.

resp.text: Dear Mr. Thrash: Thank you so much for your rating and comments. We are pleased to know our Team is exceeding your expectations. We strive to deliver professional member service - especially during these challenging times which is causing the longer than usual wait times as you mention. Your comments will be passed along to the Team members and their branch supervisor. If there is anything else we can assist with, please feel free to reach out to the NHCU representative that assisted you or to marketing@newhcu.org anytime.

name: Josh Cocoris
text:
Been a NHCU member for over 12 years. Have financed several vehicles from them, never had an issue.

Recently it's nigh impossible to actually use this bank. Lobby is closed, and drive through is 20-30 cars deep. I don't have 45 mins to sit in line to deposit a check during the work week. On Saturday it's even worse, if your normal branch is open on Sat.. (they aren't). Not even to mention if I was a member of a diff bank/CU I could just use an app to deposit my checks.. can't do that with NHCU.

Fix it guys... or you're going to lose more business including my own.

resp.text: Dear Mr. Cocoris:  Thank you for comments, and we certainly apologize for the inconvenience you are experiencing.  Please know that we do offer other options for deposits through our Mobile App.  Your comment suggested we didn't have this service -but we do and have had it for years. This has been an education and change of habit for our members who we hope start looking into our free electronic services a bit more.  Information is available on our website at NewHCU.org.  We also offer branch night drop boxes for payments and deposits, as well as two deposit capable ATMs - one at our West Mobile branch and one at our Daphne branch.  We hope to install more in the near future.  We also do have lobby service - but it is by appointment only.  If you know when you'd like to come to a branch, you can make an advance appointment to avoid the wait.  With that said, we will be relocating our Brookley branch to Midtown in January 2021 because that larger facility will allow us to open our lobby fully (with social distancing restrictions, of course) as well as offer drive-thru service.    Appointments will still be encouraged because of the social distancing mandates by the state of Alabama.  So, even if a branch is open - only so many members can be served or wait at any one time until state requirements are changed.  Look for announcements about the opening of our Midtown branch in 2021 soon.   Although we offer no Saturday  hours, we do have extended Friday hours through 6 p.m. in an effort to serve as many members prior to the weekend as possible.  Please know for the safety of our staff as well as our members - we must abide by the health restrictions.  Your patience as we get through these challenging times is greatly appreciated.

name: Deliliah Driver
text: This is absolutely  ridiculous! This is the ONLY bank in Mobile that does not offer same day appointments, doors are not open and the drive through is always down Airport! I understand COVID and the risk! I work in Healthcare I truly do but what about being accessible to your customers!

resp.text: Dear Ms. Driver:  Thank you for your comment, however, we do offer same day appointments if there is time available.  Also, we offer several locations besides the branch on Airport that offers appointments and it is very possible one of those may have a time available if our Airport Branch is already booked.   New Horizons Credit Union certainly apologizes for your inconvenience and is equally frustrated by COVID issues which are beyond our control. We are trying to keep our members updated - as our website notice admits - that due to limited staff caused by the pandemic, our members, unfortunately, will experience longer than normal hold times when calling and longer wait times when visiting an office. We are encouraging our members who need face-to-face contact with a staff member, to request an appointment at any of our branches for lobby service. Appointment can be made through our website at NewHCU.org or by calling the Member Services Center reps at 1-800-824-3610. Some branches are able to also coordinate curb-side service. New Horizons Credit Union and our staff would much rather face-to-face contact, but we must remain safe to continue operating and serving our members. For this reason, we offer several other options: Night Drop Boxes at all locations for after hour payments/deposits that will be collected each morning by 8:30 a.m.; a deposit capable ATM at both our West Mobile & Daphne locations, partnership with AllPoint ATM network so members do not have to wait to use our branch ATMs for surcharge free transactions using our debit card (our website at NewHCU.org has a listing of all 55,000 ATM locations nationwide), free 24/7 electronic services such as Online &Mobile Banking, free Voice-24 telephone account access, and free iBill Pay service. Also, our free e-Statements allow you to see what checks have cleared quicker than waiting for mailed statements. Loans can be applied for online as well via our website at NewHCU.org. Our Member Services Center reps at 1-800-824-3610 can help you get enrolled in any and all of our electronic services so you can avoid lines for simple transactions or inquiries. We do apologize for the inconvenience, and can only ask for your patience while we all get through this together.

name: Denise Harris-Wright
text: New Horizon Credit Union  I know COVID-19 has changed some banking but you all have to do a better job. You have cars & truck  all on Airport Blvd. This is a hazard and eventually cause an accident soon. May you should have more than one location open on Saturdays.  If this continues your members will go to another credit union or bank. I hope you listen to your members. Good Day

resp.text: Dear Ms. Harris-Wright:  Yes, COVID has created operation challenges with limited staff due to closed day-cares and healthy safety concerns, and yet we remain one of the few financial institutions that continue to offer Saturday hours at all - and we hope to continue as long as we can despite the rising cases being reported by the state.    Please know for specific account needs where a drive-thru visit would not be long enough, we do allow for appointment only lobby service.  Appointment can be made through our website at NewHCU.org or by calling the Member Services Center reps at 1-800-824-3610. Some branches are coordinating curb-side service.  New Horizons Credit Union and our staff are equally frustrated that we cannot do more and stay within safe parameters.  For this reason, we offer several other options:  Night Drop Boxes at all locations for after hour payments/deposits that will be collected each morning by 8:30 a.m.; a deposit capable ATM at both our West Mobile & Daphne locations,  partnership with AllPoint ATM network so members do not have to wait to use our branch ATMs for surcharge free transactions using our debit card (our website at NewHCU.org has a listing of all 55,000 ATM locations nationwide), free 24/7 electronic services such as Online &Mobile Banking, free Voice-24 telephone account access, and free iBill Pay service.  Also, our free e-Statements allow you to see what checks have cleared quicker than waiting for mailed statements. Our Member Services Center reps at 1-800-824-3610 can help you get enrolled in any and all of our electronic services so you can avoid lines for simple transactions or inquiries.  We do apologize for the inconvenience, and can only ask for your patience while we all get through this.

text:
Update 1Feb2020: (Went in today with a Military Power Of Attorney for my wife who is deployed to deposit 2 checks into my account. I was lied to multiple times, first excuse/lie was I need to put power of attorney on her account. I never told them what bank she’s with and also the POA was in the tellers hand when she told me this. Second excuse/lie was that they had a company policy against this. I asked to see this policy that supersedes a Federal Military POA and they refused to show me.. Then I was told I would need to talk to ASE’s attorney so I said ok let me talk to them, he wasn’t in and they refused to give me his contact info. They then handed me my documents back and told me to have a nice day and ignored me through the glass. This was all done at the drive thru window and they never even read the Military POA.
Instead of admitting they didn’t know how to properly process this transaction and would contact their management, they instead lied multiple times and decided to ignore me like a 10 year old. I will be contacting management about this and then switching banks. I’m an excellent customer with positive cash flow and won’t be treated like this.)
Terrible excuse for a bank. Shady business practices. You force me to accept terms in order to gain access to my account. In those terms it states that you are limiting electronic transactions to $5,000 a month.
On top of that, you won’t even accept change unless it’s “rolled”. It’s legal tender! ACTUAL MONEY! If you won’t even put MY MONEY into MY ACCOUNT then what good are you as a bank to me??
Your fired as my bank.

resp.text:
Mr. Hermann,
I am sorry you feel your transaction was not handled properly and I would like the opportunity to discuss this situation with you further. Please contact Tonya Alford at 334-420-7510 at your earliest convenience. Thank you

name: Katie Sivad
text: I would rate it no stars if possible. Terrible excuse for a bank let alone a business limited to no access to my money when it's needed they have given away my personal information to a stranger over the phone and refused to let me dispute the charges made on my account after they gave away my sensitive information. Terrible establishment with the honest exception of two women that are very nice and helpful the rest of them are rude and quite useless and my expiriences at this particular location have ensured that I will never trust Alabama state employees credit union again at any location. It would be more productive to demolish this location and put up a second Sonic less than ten feet from the other than to allow this lazy establishment to continue handling people's personal income

name: johnny johnson
text: This bank likes charging NSF fees for pending transactions that never actually post! Then when you explain to them that it's not actually pending charges, but authorization holds that fall off your account within 3 to 4 days without ever posting, they will keep NSF fees they like charging you even after they see the damn proof that funds were actually there for the transactions you made minus the authorization holds . It's 2019   and you would think they would understand online transactions by now but they refuse to actually listen to you. Instead they are rude and just tell you not to make online transactions... I guess I should also go by a VCR and pay Blockbuster a  visit. Maybe everyone with an Android phone or Amazon shippers should go back to Walmart for all their Christmas shopping as well. Online transactions are bad. LMAO! They are theives that just like to seize on any opportunities to charge fees. Go to a modernized bank

name: Jody Keisha Bowden
text: Nice friendly staff that will go out of their way to help.

name: Tiffany Smith
text: Nothing but good experiences dealing with the nice people there.

name: Rebecca Rolling
text: Love the staff! Very helpful

name: Vicki Moore
text: Everyone is very friendly.

name: Jodie McKinley
text: When I opened my checking and savings accounts, they were supposed to be linked so if in the event of an checking account overdraft, I would be only be charged a $5.00 fee to transfer needed funds. This did not happen and when I neglected to transfer funds from my savings to my checking before dropping $$$ at the DMV to renew our tags and purchase a new car tag and do some grocery shopping, I was charged $300 in OD fees even though I had adequate funds in my savings account to cover the transactions. This was all on ACU! It took three phone calls, two emails, and several weeks to get their mess straightened out because they "needed to verify that they actually made a mistake" and that it was not my fault the accounts were not initially linked. I was also told that they *may* not reimburse all the fees I was charged even though THEY made the error. Eventually I was reimbursed but while they took their time, I was out the funds they took from my account for over two weeks!

resp.text: We’re sorry you had to deal with that inconvenience, Jodie. We will look into this process and see what we can do to improve it moving forward.

name: Anthony S
text:
Does not recommend. This isnt the little down home place it once was. As they’ve grown, they have become more like the big corporate banks i tried to stay away from. I have 2 car loans and checking/ savings with them. When i get back in town I’m looking transfer these account to, pretty much anywhere else.  In my experience, when inquiring about anything such as a loan, you dont talk with someone face to face. Filling out the paperwork online, you talk to someone over the phone who just happens to be in Alabama. And they do like to take their tome about it. Which was one of the reasons I didnt go with some out of state or online company; although in retrospect I’ve had better experiences with them.
The killer for me was today, when they denied me deferring a payment due to my father passing last week and being out of town for that. Which probably wouldn't bother me quite as bad (it was due prior to my request), but Avadian literally sent me an email 3 weeks ago telling me i could skip my August payment for the fun of it (See below)
“You may be planning to spend the money on a trip, to make a surprise purchase, throw a birthday party, or just to build your savings, just send in the coupon by August 15, 2020. (Note: There is a $40 processing fee to skip your payment“

resp.text: We’re sorry to hear you’ve had a bad experience with us, Anthony. Could we have someone reach out to you and discuss this? If you would be so kind as to send us a private message with the best number and time, we’d like to get in touch.

name: Robin Murray
text:
I’ve always preferred Credit Unions over big banks because they take the time to get to know their customers . Ive never had to worry about any problems too with anyone getting into my account or copying my card - these folks at Avadian catch problems before you , the consumer ever know what’s going on . And , if there’s anything remotely suspicious with your account , they will call you to verify purchases before they okay them .

I’m so happy to be banking with the fine folks at Avadian Credit Union , formerly known as Alabama Telco Credit Union !!!

Thank you to each and every one of you that work so hard to keep our money safe . You are very important to me and I think you all do a much better job than any bank I’ve ever been with .

Robin Murray

name: Ricky Duncan
text: Slime

resp.text: Ricky, we hate to hear that you’ve had a bad experience. It’s difficult for us to improve if you don’t give us any further detail.

name: Mrs.
text: I have been with the bank owning just a savings account for almost 9 years. But I must say my experience today was deplorable!! The level of customer service I got today was as if this company was established in the ghetto. I was trying to get a fee of $30 removed from my savings account that a payment from my school loan for only $10 was rejected. I was passed to 5 different people all the way to the Trussville branch when I originally established my account at the Colonnade location. One of the ghetto women that I spoke to got extremely rude with me and hung the phone up in my face. First of all I never signed anything stating I agreed to overdraft fees on a savings account and 2nd of all why would you charge me $30 for a $10 rejected fee?? No one explained this to me in the whole almost 9 years that I have had this worthless account. I said to heck with it Im just going to close it...but noo not because of the $30 fee, but because of the level of customer service I got. I would not recommend this bank for savings or checking for that matter., They may be well on loans I do believe that. But I have gone ahead and changed all my deposits I have going into this account so that I can close it IMMEDIATELY!!! They are out of compliance and have predatory fees. Thanks AVADIAN. But your services will NEVER be needed again from me. Good Riddance.

name: Victoria Wilson
text: Personal service

resp.text: Thank you for the review Victoria!

name: Larry Viles
text: I have been an active member for over 50 years and have always held the AACFCU at the top of my five star list. And my last and every visit only serves to reinforce my decision. Sadly, the name change was made before anyone asked for my input. Loss of the identity with the Army Aviation Center was, in my modest opinion,  a significant blow to prestige of our financial institution. One that wouldn't even exist without our wonderful Army Aviation Center. Enough said on this subject. The staff that serve us members are, for the most part, professional, friendly, & helpful. The COVID-19 problem has been addressed in an effective manner minimizing as much inconvenience as possible keeping everyone as safe as possible. A five star rating has been earned and is well deserved.

name: Brenda McHugh
text:
I love the services they offer but they need more help!
Always have to wait in drive up or inside.

name: Chelsea Greer
text: This bank used to be great 5 years ago. Now there are new faces every time I go. I’ve banked here for a total 7 years. During setting up my account after moving back the teller put all money into savings instead of checking causing several transfer fees that they wouldn’t wave. Today (2:18pm)  the teller announced my social security number were other people (not employees) could hear and also announced it was my social. After 10+min in the car line With it not moving someone decided to come out and tell me the speaker didn’t work. The teller sent me to wait again but helped the car in front of me. I was polite because I understand this stuff happens, however, it wasn’t fair for others to be helped while I needed to wait again behind an even longer line. I decided to go inside. I waited another 15minutes inside. I thought I would take care of my account being charged monthly while depositing a check for someone else. I feel the woman absolutely did not want to help me, she kept trying to send me to the online app even though I told her it didn’t work last time. She said they would help me after I got another months fee,  just like they did over 6 months ago. She said there was nothing she could do to help me but said to come back and a teller could help me in a month??? I’m positive those fees won’t be waved either.

name: C Ray
text: The new name is silly.  "All In" is a gambling term.  It doesn't convey fiduciary savvy when used by a financial institution entrusted with the stewardship of members' money.

name: AK Sasser
text: Good local bank friendly staff, hate the building is so grubby looking.

name: April Thorpe
text: It doesn't work half the time

name: Jeff king
text: I have not had to go into this location for a long while, even before COVID locked the doors. I have never had a bad experience with the staff here.

resp.text: Thank you for the 4 star review, Jeff! Is there anything else we could do to make this a five star? We are always looking to improve!

name: Josh Taylor
text: I don’t normally complain about local businesses but I’ve about had enough of being nickel and dimed from Avadian Credit Union. My wife and I both have separate accounts with them and have had mortgages and car loans. We sold our house and moved last April and unbeknownst to us have been getting charged an incorrect address fee every month ever since. Strange thing is that the new house that we built was financed through Avadian as well so they obviously have our current address. We rarely use that account as a primary checking so it went unnoticed this entire time.  This is not the first time we have gotten these types of fees as well as inactivity fees from Avadian. Just posting this so that other folks can hopefully avoid similar situations with a credit union that does business in this fashion.

resp.text: We are sorry you feel this way Josh. It’s important for us to have a current address on file so that we do not send important information to an address where someone else currently resides. Have you gotten the current address added to the account? We would like to make sure this is resolved.

name: it's me T “Its me T” Bux
text: There is one teller here that is great, but without her this credit union is nothing. I bank with credit unions for their hospitality to the local community. This one is truly lacking.

Thank you for the review, Cathy! We actually
have three locations open on Saturday. Greystone, Hoover, and Trussville are all open from 9am-12pm on Saturdays.

name: LEGION 4wermany
text: I went to my bank to make a simple deposit into my checking account. As I've always done I have money transferred from my checking to other accounts to pay bills and etc. I was informed by an untrained teller that I wouldn't be unable to do my bank transactions unless I had the exact amounts including change memorized, of each loan and credit card amounts which were several. the untrained teller had to get up at every question I had, and go back to the branch manager to ask for advice this happened six times and the branch manager still didn't come out to take control or help with the situation. I ended up having to leave without my bills being paid because of their incompetence I have zero faith in the abilities of America's first credit Union. the staff was rude and incompetent including the branch manager something needs to be done to make a change here or I will be taking our business elsewhere my advice to whoever reads this review is don't come here! P. S. The turnover rate here is off the charts.

name: Koleton Kelley
text: I just attempted to go through the drive Thru lane only one teller taking so long to do each transaction. I wanted for over 10 min and she still wasn’t done with one customer. This needs to get better. Or I am switching to somewhere that can actually get things done in a timely manor.

name: Lynn Cleghorn
text: Typically I have no complaints with our bank. Been with them for many years . But what really gets on my nerves is each teller has their own set of rules for your account.   I have deposited personal checks for $20-100. And most of the time iitis not an issue with the bank. But in the last year 1 will say they have to put it on a 10 day hold, new guidelines.  Then the next time I'm expecting it again and they say no we dont have to do a hold. It irritates the crap.out of me. So what you have a bad day so you make the rules up as you go?

name: David Key
text: This LEEDS, AL branch is the best one so far. The staff is courteous and friendly and is knowledgeable. Other branches I have visited had nice staff as well but this is my go to place.

name: Spencer Webb
text: Called up there this morning and instead of answering the phone, the representative present hung up on me, when it’s my money on the line you don’t hang up on people

name: Nick Nunnelley
text: My wife and I went to americas first because of all their advertising on auto loans and how great they are, we were approved in minutes for a loan of 8000 dollars with a low interest of %5.....GREAT!!! we drive to GEORGIA from BIRMINGHAM to get the car and it wasn't as expected. So, we look around while there and find a NEWER car with LESS miles. Call americas first back, great no problem, even lower monthly payments than first anticipated, GREAT DEAL. DRIVE BACK TO THE CARLOT AND SPEND THE NIGHT IN GEORGIA.  We get the car lot to run the papers, fax them to americas first where we have ALREADY BEEN APPROVED, DRIVE BACK TO ANNISTON (the closest americas first) after spending the night in georgia, make it all the way there and they tell us &quot;OOPS, our mistake, we cant finance it for what we already approved you, only DOUBLE THE PAYMENTS with more money down.&quot; after we tell them the situation and complain, the best answer we get is &quot;sorry wish we could help&quot; sad thing is i was so impressed with all their grand ads and commercials i was about to change all of my banking over to them. when i went back in and talked to the branch manager she was extremely defensive, and seemed more concerned with blaming my wife and myself than admitting that they miscommunicated. the worse thing is it was the actual branch manager who pre-approved us and even went as far as telling us exactly what to get the dealer to fax them so they could finalize the loan and "have a check waiting." Glad they showed their true colors and only wasted 300 DOLLARS of our money before i made that mistake!!!

name: jamarris bozeman

name: kvwes89
text: have been a customer for over 5 years with no issues until this last week. They closed a checking account that I have had for some time without any type of notification via email, mail or phone call. On top of this, I found out that the account was closed when I tried to use the card and could not get into my online account. When I called to get details on why the account had been closed, I was given the complete run around, and up to this very moment, I STILL have no clue why my account was closed without notification. To add to this, the individual who needs to answer these questions has been off the entire week. Apparently only one person in the whole bank system deals with customers on these issues. I would not dare recommend ASECU after the experience I have had these past few days.

THANKS ASE for HIRING employees like J...

Kayla,

name: Ella R. Brown

name: SHARANNA BROWN
text: Don’t even bother. ASE has the worst customer service. While I understand policies and procedures, their deliverance is inappropriate. I’ve literally only had ONE pleasant experience here, despite banking with them for over three years. Because I’ve had better experiences elsewhere, I know this is not a matter of my being unreasonable when asking a credit union to be transparent and at the very least, pleasant. My experience with ASE was so horrible I closed my account and refinanced my vehicle elsewhere. Despite the 1.9 interest rate, I just COULD NOT deal with their condescending representatives anymore.

resp.text: Hello, Sharanna! We are saddened to hear that your recent experience with your local ASECU was less than great. We always want to make sure we’re doing our best to meet the needs of our clients. We think this sounds like a wonderful training experience for us; we would love to hear from you! If you have a moment, please email us directly at this link with the details and we’ll make sure to review them - https://app.yourasecu.com/contact. Thank you for your message, and we hope you have a great week!

name: Louise Nelson Beverett
text: Why is the lobby not open, why do employees don't knjow them and numbers of their board of directors, why does the CEO, Mike hart have a regions bank address.    If I can go to grocery store, have my hair and nails done, and eat in a restaurant, can't I come in to the lobby.      Is it still ASE, the E stood for employees.  What has happened. Louise Beverett

name: Gerry Goodson
text: Gerald Steele is one of the best she always take care of me anytime I come to the Interstate Park branch with any issues. Great bank with  Super friendly and welcoming staff.

name: Patricia Flowers
text: I’ve been a member at ASE for a few years now. I originally joined the one in Clanton Alabama When I lived up their. Once I moved to Montgomery I started using this location. I am self employed and get paid by personal checks from my clients. I use to be able to pull up to the drive through and just deposit my checks and they be in my account With in minutes. Just so happens last week they tell me I have to wait two Business days before my money would be available. Now to remind you they’ve been cashing my checks for two months now! And the only in Clanton would just deposit them in my account with no hold! To make things even worse the Teller told me to go to the bank that’s on the check!! I’m like how rude is that when I come here every week and the same teller deposit the check in my account and make it available Right then... I’m thinking about closing all of my accounts... My husband and daughter are thinking they will close their accounts when I do

name: MadDogNoGood

Brian J.

name: Todd Braden
text: Great place to bank. Very nice people at Greenville location!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to review us. We very much appreciate the positive feedback. Thank you for choosing ASE!

name: Lisa Jackson
text: Love going to Perryhill branch it's wonderful to know as many customers come by the drive thur and Rayford still knows you by name make me feel good . Thanks for all you do.

resp.text: We appreciate you Ms. Jackson. Glad to exceed your expectations!

name: Jhonatan Castillo
text:
I applied for a loan on 3/28/19. I called on 4/2/19 and I was told someone was working on my application and that I would be contacted the next day. I waited another day and finally called and asked to speak with the person working on my application. I was told that my VM was full and that she couldn’t get in touch with me. I spoke with the lady and submitted further documentation needed.

I waited another week and decided to go into the branch myself. I waited in the waiting area only to find out that you have to go up front. While standing in line, a gentleman walked in and he sat down. I was told by the bank teller that the lady would be with me in a few moments. Then, the gentleman who walked in was immediately seen by none other, the person I needed to see. Furthermore, a lady walked in and she was greeted and helped by another worker. By this time, I’ve been in the branch for over 45 minutes without actually being helped.

This place is ridiculous!

resp.text: Hello, Jhonatan! We apologize for any miscommunication on our behalf during your recent loan application. Just as you mentioned, we will sometimes need additional information from a customer before we are able to proceed with the application. It sounds like we didn’t do a great job of communicating that, and for that we apologize. Furthermore, we apologize for the poor experience you recently had at one of our branches. We always do our best to see our customers in the order in which they arrived, and we thank you for your patience during that time. If there’s anything more we can help with, please feel free to reach out directly by using this form https://app.yourasecu.com/contact - Thank you!

name: Christina Rhodes
text: They keep changing their loan policies and skip payments. I started a new job and would like a little bit of cushion for this month. I have over a 700 credit score. But rough times happen and the skip payment are designed for those times... Not times when the bank thinks I should be struggling. They would rather take then help. They will be losing me as a customer.

name: CHARLENE REED
text: This is by far the best Credit Union/Bank I've ever dealt with.  I LOVE ASE!!!

resp.text: Thanks Charlene!

name: Barrett Sharpe
text:
With twenty people standing in line one of the three tellers closes her window and goes for lunch?  Wow.

Redeeming quality, the teller that helped me was efficient and very nice.

name: Remy
text: Staff is very nice, overall great experience here

resp.text: Thanks Remy, we are looking forward to exceeding your expectations on future visits!

name: April Taurus
text: I normally like this credit union, even though I'm no longer a member, but today I got the rudest customer service rep. She said she was at the call center in Wetumpka and was of absolutely no help. In the past, I dealt with reps at the branch off of Perry Hill Rd, and they are all always friendly and polite, even when they had to give me news I didn't particularly want to hear, lol. The lady I spoke with today needs to take lessons from those ladies in Montgomery because she is severely lacking any type of phone etiquette or courtesy. Plus she was loud.

name: Rebecca Atteberry
text: I have always had perfect service from ASE.  On phone, internet, or in person.    Great people.

name: Jamie Jordan
text: Jay was very helpful ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

The telephone customer support is absolutely horrible.

name: Tarius Sledge
text: Amazing

name: Tori Applegate
text: I had an account get overdrawn. I missed the thirty day pay back mark by TWO DAYS. I didn't get a letter or anything of the sort. They didn't say it went to collections when I paid it off. The account never closed and stayed in "good standing". Got a ping that I had a new derogatory mark on my credit, a collection. I went up to the credit union as soon as I saw it and asked if anything could be done. They said no. So thanks for nothing at all. I will be closing my account ASAP and will recommend penair to no one. AL Credit Union is such a better choice and they forgive if you forget by a day or two to pay something. Not to mention they try to help you build your credit not ruin it.

name: Jennifer May
text:
I have been a member for over 10 years and a CSR at the Foley Alabama branch persuade my husband while banking there. He has left my 3 kids and I for said woman and the bank decided to handle it by terminating my membership and promoting her to managers position. Pen Air has no ethics or moral standing.
On its website, the credit union boils down its brand promise to this: “We promise to value and respect the trust you’ve placed in us.”
If only that were true...

text: Very pleased with the overall experience at this branch in general. I'm especially pleased with Rachael Hambric's service and professionalism. I have been a long time customer of Pen Air's, have obtained multiple loans and Rachael has been my POC in every single one. Great experience overall.

resp.text: Alain - Thank you for taking the time to leave us with a 5 Star Review and your special comments about Rachael Hambric's service and professionalism. Thank you for being a loyal member of Pen Air!

name: Gus Delafuente
text: Always get helped fast and proper.

name: Patrease Durgin
text: I had recently went to this credit union in Foley to apply for a loan so that I can get me another car because an old car that I have is about to break down on me. The people there that I talked who works there were nice, but I hate the policy of this credit union that one of them described to me which is for example: If you have filed for bankruptcy within the last 10 years and haven't established much credit and you've never gotten a loan and paid off that loan, then you won't be able to get a loan from them because obviously they feel that your'e probably not going to pay that loan back to them. So they aren't going to give you a chance. Well how can one get their foot in the door to get a loan from them and then pay it off??? I don't think that is fair at all!! Such a stupid policy!!

resp.text: Patrease - Thank you for reaching out to us and provide us your feedback. It is important that we understand the needs of our members and listen to their pain points. We would love the continue the conversation with you to better understand your situation and see how we can develop a solution to get your credit repaired. We are hear to help. Please feel free to reach out to us at memberservicecenter@penair.org. Thank you again for your feedback.

resp.text: Shannon - Thank you for taking the time to write this review. It's important to us to hear back from our members on how we are doing. text: I agree with Shannon. I want a bank with a local number. I hate calling Florida when there is a problem. The last time I called I spoke to a Hindu that couldn't speak English. Now by the time I recieve an access code their web site is timed out. They think that no one will need to make a balance transfer for days at a time. They think everyone is psychic and can foretell the future. I wouldn't hire a Penair official to carry out my garbage , because I don't think they have the mental capacity to do the job.

Thank you for being a member at Pen Air!

We hope this helps. Thank you again for your feedback.

name: Ivorie Crear

name: David Wilkinson
text: This happened on 11/26/18 at 2:00pm. I am Caucasian and have a handicapped tag. I’m sure this is racially motivated considering the recent events at the Galleria mall but I was offended. I pulled into a handicap parking space and the guard immediately came out and looked at my tag. Once I finished my business I moved my car and watched. When people of color parked there he did not check their tags. Not once !! I’ve been with this Credit Union for 40 years and do not appreciate being singled out because of my race and recent events. Do not let this happen again or I will take my business elsewhere.

name: Mick McMeme
text: Not a good place for a long term savings account. A savings account is a place where your money can be kept safely, if they see no money added or withdrawn over a couple of months, they start charging a "fee" until the account is drained dry. The whole point of the account is to keep my money safe there. This should serve as an indicator to the type of bank this is.

name: Alden Brindle
text: Good to work with. I like that they are insured by the government. Some credit unions hove a non government insurance.

name: Davis Family 5
text: So far I am not very impressed with this credit union. I am not sure if it is just the person that we dealt with or the entire credit union.  We made an appointment to do an auto loan and it felt like the initial person that helped us at the Clanton branch talked down to us the entire time. We had to leave and get some additional documentation, which was fine, but we were not given all of the information that we needed. I had called to double check to see what we needed and so it was ready when we came back to the branch.  When we came back to the branch a couple of days later I was told that we did not have everything that we needed. On top of that, the person that was supposed to be helping was not even in the branch that day and she had passed everything off to another employee.  I understand that sometimes you can't be at work but the reason for her absence was apparently planned weeks in advance. She had made an appointment with us and we expected to meet with her since she knew the entire scenario.  We did get the loan done, and I am very appreciative of that and the employee that helped us the second time, but it was much harder than it had to be! Once we were done with the loan we, again, did not get all the information that should have been passed to us. We were informed that insurance was going to be force placed on the loan if we did not provide proof of insurance.  We got insurance on the vehicle BEFORE we even went to finalize the loan. If the proper questions were asked at the time of closing by the lender then this all could have been avoided. I hope our future encounters with this credit union are better.

name: Robert Price
text: Great employees and helped me with everything I needed.

name: Randall Phillips
text:
Personnel are always very helpful and share a smile.
Have a blessed day.

Hopefully my experience was isolated and they fired the person who screwed up my account.

name: JOCELYN MARSHALL

It took me far less time to due business then I remember and my debit card now works. Someone is doing good things to this PLACE!!!!

resp.text: Hi, Alex! Thank you for your review! We are glad that you had a positive experience at FMCU! Thank you for being a valued member!

name: ebony kilpatrick
text: Horrible service and very rude, they do not treat you like your a potential client, they treat you as if you are bothering them. Go to another branch maybe they will treat you better😊

Please feel free to reach out to us at creditunion@fortmcclellancu.org with any further comments, concerns, or suggestions. Again, we sincerely apologize for your bad experience and hope we can make things right!

name: Christin G.
text: It is always a pleasure to visit my local FMCU office. I am greeting by smiling faces that help me with my transaction or answer questions I have. I know with the Covid situation that wait times have increases. I commend the staff on staying positive and cheerful in thes unprecedented times.

resp.text: Thank you for review, Christin! We are glad to have you as a part of the Fort McClellan Credit Union family!

name: Rita Johnson
text: I just really don't understand why the drive through at the Noble St branch turns into a parking lot on Fridays. I have been in line now for 25 minutes and the line has not moved. Surely you have more than one teller. Not the same service we use to have.

name: Geri M
text: We were not greeted by anyone when we first walked in. We stood in the lobby for a good 10 minutes before anyone acknowledged us. My husband was asked to take his veteran hat off when we got to the counter , but two men that were wearing their hats while being served were never asked to remove theirs. Then I had to sit for a good 10-15 minutes to change a payment date on our accounts. Not a good way to serve your customers. Not coming back to the golden springs branch. Terrible customer service.

name: Bethany Roach
text: Went to payoff my car loan with them. The loan is in my husbands name but I have made every payment for the past 4 years on it. I waited in line for over 35 minutes. Sent in my transaction and the new slip they make you fill out saying I wanted to make a payment. I don’t get a hey, how are you,  just a aggravated voice is Mr. Roach in the car with you? Um no. Nothing else asked. Then the teller asked me to confirm some information about the loan which I did. Then she barked at me to sign a recipe. I did. Sent it back in and waited a few minutes on my copy of the recipe. Waited over 5 minutes and so I rang the call asking for a recipe, got barked back at that I’d get one when I sent my copy back in and I said I had. Sent me out a recipe. No thank you, have a good day. This place has gotten $1000s from me in the past few years and I couldn’t even be treated nicely!? Telling everyone I know to not use them for financing.

You may email us at marketing@fortmcclellancu.org regarding your experience, and we will get back with you promptly. Thank you again for your review!

After going in circles for 2 months I decided I did not want to be associated with this business. Imagine if my membership could not entered what would happen with my money. Ever time you call to speak with Beth she on a lunch break.  If you leave a message calls are never returned. If this is the best bank manager they can find I WARN everyone do not put your money here. If you are military stick with Navy Federal. The customer service is A++ compared to this.

name: Phyllis Brewer
text: I opened my account at five star in 2016 after moving back to Eufaula Alabama.  It was recommended to me by a close friend who along with himself his whole family are long time members. From the moment I stepped in the Eufaula Alabama branch the first thing I noticed was the branch was very clean and well organized. The next thing I noticed was that all of the employees were very professional and worked as a team with the common goal service to each and every customer. I even noticed that when there was no one at the drive thru the employees came in the main area to help the other tellers   My wait was less than three minutes before I was ushered into an office where I was thoroughly enjoyed the process and very well educated on all of my options.   Every time since I have opened my account I have never been dissatisfied with my service. I have used the online banking,  drive thru, night deposit, automated system,  phone service to branch to speak with someone, going into branch to dispute resolution and when my account was in negative due to a double charging from another source.  They printed off copies of my account.  They also introduced me to a repayment over draft plan. They also completely refunded over draft fees and double charges with no hassle.  And they also referred me to the dispute resolution office for some things they couldn't do they also referred me to main branch for further assistance.  They have also have informed me of certain privileges that comes with membership. That I would have never been aware of if they hadn't taken the time to show me.

Again today the closing has been postponed.  I hope Karma comes knocking on whomevers door and they get it right back 7 fold.

name: Arthur Lamounier Moura
text:
The staff was really helpful and attentive, and tried to solve my situation and provide me the information I needed. However, if you're an international student, they do not allow you to open the simplest account without having a Social Security Number with you. This is very odd, considering that all the other banks in town accept the regular immigrant documents, such as visa, I-20, passport, etc. Also, Auburn University is an institution that receives lots of International students for all over the world every semester and this Credit union did not think of a good solution for this type of customer...

Since I had to open an account in one way or another, I had to choose another bank, in my case Chase Bank... So be aware of that if you're an international student!

resp.text:
Mr. Moura,

AU Credit Union accepts one or more of the following documents for a non-U.S. person:
- Taxpayer Identification Number
- Passport Number and Country of Issuance
- Alien Identification Card Number
- Number and Country of Issuance of any other Government-Issued Document evidencing nationality or residence and bearing a photograph or similar safeguard

We sincerely apologize if one or more of the above mentioned documents were provided to us but denied at the time of your account opening. Please still consider AU Credit Union as a trusted financial institution in your local area, and contact memberservices@aufcu.org about reapplying for membership with one or more of the documents listed above.

Other lady comes over and tells me they are going to have to put a 4 day hold on my check (under $300).  I told them no, close my account.  Other lady walks away and the teller is standing there staring off into space.  Other lady comes back, and she says yes he wants to close the account, (I had been standing there for 5 minutes.)  This place needs qualified people, not kids who like to play around.  And Baye, grow some brains.

Yesterday, 10:00 a.m., I called the credit union to find out what date my bank card was ordered.  I was told that the person who ordered it had stepped out and would call me later. No return call, so I called again today to speak to that person.  She said that the only person who could order the card was on vacation and would be back Tuesday. name: E
text: Denied my car loan application when I needed it most because I haven’t “been on my job long enough.” As a registered nurse who is in high demand during a pandemic, I’m sure that I will maintain my job to pay a car note. Also, they did not verify my source of income by requesting a pay stub to see how much I actually make or check loan payment history. I have never been late on a payment for my home or student loans. She did not offer another solution to my request. They are not friendly at this branch nor do they offer solutions to maximize your saving. The lack of staff diversity is also saddening. Very disappointed and I will be closing my account.

name: Susan Johnson
text:
I have been a member of this Credit Union for fifty (50) years; and I have never been treated like I was at this branch. I have gone to the Homewood Branch for 50 years, and could not today because it is temporarily closed.

As I entered the Branch I was motioned to go up to a window that had a table in front of it. I understand the Covid regulations; however, when I asked to see the manager three times, I was denied. She (Angela) came back from lunch and sat at her desk waiting on no one. I asked repeatedly if I could go to her desk and sit for two reasons: I’m suffering from hamstring tendinitis; and I had four things that needed to be handled, and it is painful to stand for long periods of time.

The young man at the counter said he could help me; even though he kept asking for help. That is one reason I kept asking for the manager, to speed up the process. I came to fill out a “dispute charges” form ( he could not do that), get a temporary debit card,  because I was told to cut mine up by someone at the Alabaster location.

The cashier at the counter began to ask for my personal information (account number and last four digits of my SS number) in a loud voice and expected me to holler my personal information from 6 Ft away. Talk about identity theft, let’s just tell everyone in the lobby! I was appalled that he cared more about germs than securing my personal identity. I asked to write info on a piece of paper.

Then he obviously did not know how to dispute charges, again asking for help. Now Angela gets up to go assist him. She never introduced herself to me, apologize to me for delay or inconvenience. They huddled in a corner of Branch long enough for me to ask if there was a problem. This young man was oblivious as to what to do. Angela finished the transaction, and then they were ready for me to leave. I again asked for a temporary debit card, cash and checkbook cover.

I taught Business Education in Jefferson County for 32 years, and none of these employees would have passed in my classes.  They need to improve on human relations, how to treat customers, and how to show kindness to older people, especially ones who say they are disabled.

I will probably have to return to this branch, if Homewood isn’t open. If I do, I hope I see some changes.

name: Orlando Chandler
text: I am very disappointed, the web site is always down and they don't answer there phone, I will be looking for another credit union as soon as possible. Nice and polite does not pay my bills in emergency situation.

name: DawnMarie 223
text: Would give 0 stars if I could. I have been banking with ECO for 10 years and never had a problem. Recently I went through a divorce and had the banker Blake at this location remove my ex from my accounts. DO NOT DO ANY TRANSACTIONS WITH HIM. He doesn’t know what he is doing. Even another worker at another location told me he did it incorrectly. He only took my ex off of the checking and not the savings even after I told him to remove from both. I was not aware that he only fixed my checking & My ex was then able to wipe all of my money out of my savings account through transferring it to his personal account.  The bank says even though it was a banker error, I have lost my money and there is nothing they can do but ask him to give the money back which he of course will not do. I have tried to get in touch with the head manager over the branches & I have left messages  to no avail. Since there are no repercussions for the bankers actions  I will be closing both of my accounts as well as both of my sons’ savings accounts here.

text: I absolutely LOVE this credit union!  Everyone in there is so personable and truly cares about you.  The branch manger Kelley, is AWESOME!!!! She goes above and beyond to help clients.  We've financed multiple cars with them, refinanced cars, had business accounts open, personal accounts.. you name it, we've done it, and Kelley and the rest of the team at this branch has made it happen with ease!   We now live in Texas, and refuse to leave them!  We will always have an account with Eco, for sure as long as Kelley Calhoun is there!  If you want a personal banking experience and are tired of the cookie cutter big baking experience, go see Kelley or one of her team members at Eco in Riverchase!

text: They have horrible customer service. Every month, it is like pulling teeth to get them to actually take a payment on an auto loan. There is always something. This month, they’re not allowed to speak with me about my husband’s auto loan. We have given written permission several times, not to mention, this isn’t a problem each month. I have spoken to other representatives about the account before. However, this month it was a problem. I know our payment amount, however, the rep would not confirm that the amount I gave was correct. I also asked if we were on a paperless billing cycle with them since we did not receive a statement this month and she refused to answer. When questioned, she stated her department can’t speak to me about the account but other departments can. Seriously?? This is just one of the many reasons I hate making this call every month. We also have to pay $10 for them to take our payment over the phone. We refuse to mail a check because they will “lose it” and we will be charged more fees. We are not close to a branch and can’t make it to a drive thru without being inconvenienced. So, we pay them to take our money each month. Do yourself a favor and use another bank for your auto loan or any other banking needs.

resp.text:
Thank you for reaching out, Jennifer. We would like to apologize that your experience has not been up to our Guardian standards, and hope we can speak with you further about this.

An alternative to paying your loan payment over the phone is using Guardian's Free Mobile App to make a loan payment. Visit  http://bit.ly/GuardianDigitalSolutions for more information, or feel free to reach out to our team at 334-244-9999 to speak with one of our team members about this.

Also, if you need your online password reset or any other customer service over the weekend, they’re closed so forget it. Their equity line checks are exactly like their regular checking checks, so be very careful to differentiate. Their staff is very nice and helpful, though.

name: Art of Zink
text:
I have been with this credit union happily for six years, but I believe I no longer will be after what has happened tonight.
I was waiting on my check to clear today so that I could get a ride home from the convention that I am currently working at in Columbus, Ohio. My check cleared, but Tyndall Federal Credit Union's system decided to automatically withhold every last dime from my pay check. Not only do I not have access to any of my funds, I couldn't even get a ride back to my hotel, and I'm stranded in the middle of a city that I'm unfamiliar with. After calling every number I could think of (and even frantically trying to contact them on Facebook messenger), The only option I had was to call local police dispatch to get a ride back to my hotel so that I didn't have to walk back through a dangerous part of town.
The fact that you don't have an after hours emergency service number has literally put me in a very dangerous situation. it's a shame, but I don't believe I will be banking with you any longer.

name: brian collins
text:
Today I closed my accounts at America's First after having been a member for over 35 years.  I've tried to be patient, understanding that they are a smaller institution and lack the systems and experience of larger institutions but it finally became too much to tolerate.  It's been a comedy of ineptitude, bad systems and offensive behavior.

My account was originally a solo account and we added my wife to the account when we got married almost 30 years ago.  The Credit Union kept losing or failing to acknowledge that document.  I must have added her as a fully authorized user and joint owner on the account over five times through the years.  Once, they wouldn't allow her to pay off a loan saying she wasn't authorized to make payments on a loan we took out together.

My children have each been stranded out of town with no access to their cash when the credit union froze their accounts suspecting their travel meant fraud.  In each case, the credit union was notified prior to their trips and they still locked their accounts.  In each case, it was over a weekend and they were unable to remove the block until a business day.  One child was in New York City with no cash for food, taxi, subway.  The other was in Minnesota.  Our only choice was to wire our kids cash via Western Union.

Our accounts have been compromised at least 3 times where someone other than us had an AmFirst issued card with our account information and gone on shopping sprees.  In each case the onus was on us to prove we didn't make the purchase, and we had to wait for weeks to be refunded but the credit union refused to give us any case information so we could bring charges against the criminal or even go to police.  They said the fraud was against them, not us.

A fraudster gained access to our son's account and he drove to America's First to report the problem.  They refused to lock his card saying they couldn't verify he wasn't making the out of state purchases as he stood there in the branch.  He stood there with the banker as they watched purchase after purchase drain his account down to zero.

The final straw was me taking a cashiers check from my investment broker to deposit in my Americas First account.  It was a sizable check but not the first time I'd moved funds between the accounts.  AmFirst said they would have to freeze my funds for 10 business days to make sure the check was good.  They said they had never seen a check from Merrill Lynch and didn't know what to do with it.  I said they could call my broker to verify.  The banker then accused me of attempting felony fraud.  She didn't know if it was a real check and even if it was, I could cash the check then drive to my broker to remove the funds.  I was stunned.  After a 35ish year relationship with Americas First, I'm suddenly going to start passing fraudulant financial instruments?

No more.  I'm done with them.

name: James Baldwin
text: I left a review for this so called 'credit union' a while back, but obviously someone didn't like it, and it's not here any longer. So, I'm leaving another one to warn you not to trust these people with your money. This is formerly Jefferson County Employees Credit Union, only available to County employees. But after the County filed bankruptcy and laid everyone off, it had to go public to sustain itself. It is still owned and operated by Jefferson County employees, if that tells you anything.  I had a checking and savings account here, along with a line of credit loan. My direct deposit was set up to go 100% into my checking acct., minus my loan payment. But for some reason, they would out of the blue deposit into my savings acct., and my loan wouldn't get paid. AND more than once, my entire paycheck was applied to my loan, without my permission or notification, leaving me with no money! And THEN, they refused to reverse the payment and put the money back! I got away from these idiots and went to a real bank. I recommend everyone else do the same.

text: Be Careful if you are a member here. They will attempt to call you and tell you that they are with the fraud department and that they want to verify some purchases made from your account because there were some "red flag" transactions. They will then say did you make a 500 dollar purchase at a Target in "so and so" California......you will say NO then that's when they will proceed to get the ACTUAL information they need to get your money! Be safe, Be aware, and Give NO information unless you are "in person" at the actual Bank. Good luck, and God Bless.

name: Joseph Harris
text: I'm not sure if the underwriter that just called me is extremely racist or just don't know what's she's doing. I went to the rural king in Chester Pa and saw an equipment that i wanted to purchase for my business. Spoke to a rep there and he told me that I can apply for their business credit card though redstone federal credit union. So i applied on Sunday 05/18/20. On Monday a Melissa Wilson called me back and said the credit card was approved but she need to open a membership for me first to finalize everything. She took my basic information and said I'll received a docu sign by the end of the day. I got an email from Melissa on Tuesday night saying that the underwriter needed 2 year of business tax returns, a utility bill, a mortgage statement and a selfie of myself with me holding my ID. I thought the last request was a little strange but I submitted everything anyway. Got a call from an underwriter on Wednesday and this is where I think she just dont have a clue about what she's doing or is extremely racist. She asked me how far was rural king store was from me? I told her about an hour plus. She then ask why I close two credit cards in 2019. Told her I had two credit cards from the same company so I requested that they combine the credits from both cards on to one and close one, which they did. And that i didn't close the barclay card. I was an authorized user on the barclay card and the primary user close the card that's why why it appear on my credit as close. But I went ahead and open up my personal barclay card in December of 2019. She then ended by saying well I'm not satisfied with the two cards that were closed, and there's a fraud alert on your credit and this seems like fraud. I told her yes I place a fraud alert on my credit so that no one can open up fraudulent account in my name. A fraud alert will tell a company to give me a call and verify its me before opening up a new account. People do that all the time. She said well this seems like fraud. I told her you have my ID, Mortgage statement, utility bill, my social security number, phone number that you're talking to me on matches the phone number with the credit bureau that's on my fraud alert, my 2 years of business tax returns with my business name and my home address. I have a 732 fico score and a 80/100 dunn and Bradstreet score. I have all the credentials needed for approval. Credit, income, etc. But all they saw was a driver's license of a beard black guy, that have a fraud alert place on his credit and two close credit cards that one of them he requested to be closed and the other was close by the primary card holder. And the scary part about this entire situation is the young lady that told me all this is an "underwriter". An underwriter who's racist or an underwriter that don't know that it's legal to call the credit bureau and request that they place a fraud alert on your credit and give them a number to place on your credit to have potential credit call you and verify its you before opening an account. Also an underwriter that don't know that if you become an authorized user on one of your family members card that entire card history gets transferred to your credit history. And if the person closes that card it will also close on you credit profile. So much for " Equal Opportunity Lender".

resp.text: Let me assure you that RFCU has a strict policy of non-discrimination not only in the credit union’s lending practices, but in all aspects of conduct throughout RFCU. When opening accounts and taking applications for credit, RFCU must complete certain due diligence requirements in order to validate the identity of the applicant, as required by federal law. Due diligence is completed for every applicant in order to both comply with federal law and safeguard our members from potential fraud.

I really like banking with All In, but there is one thing that has me thinking about closing my account with them. Back in November of 2020 I went on a trip to Colorado where I rented a car from hertz Denver airport location.Hertz overcharged me $711.00.
So I called All in to file a dispute(this was in December)they sent me the paperwork and told me I would have to wait until they hear something from hertz. January had come and I called the representative stated that they are waiting to hear from hertz still no answers from hertz. Called In February still no answer from hertz and the rep advised me by law they have to give the merchant 180 days. I called again at the end of March early April. Spoke with a representative who advised me they still haven’t heard anything from hertz and that the 180 days are coming to an end by the end of April and for me to callback then. So I waited until May 4, 2021 to call back spoke with a representative named Beverly. Beverly called over to whatever department that handles disputes only to tell me that they still haven’t heard from hertz. Also she advised me that she was told that even though the 180 days were over I still will have to wait until they hear something from hertz. I’m very frustrated because I was told to wait 180 days and still have to wait. All in has showed me that they do not care about their customers only when it benefits them. All in needs a better way to navigate for their customers when it comes to overcharges. I really feel like I got the short in of the stick because I have patiently waited and All in failed. What was the purpose of me waiting 180 days if you guys are going to keep yo-yo in me around?! BEWARE IF YOUR OVERCHARGED BY A MERCHANT ALL IN WILL HAVE YOU PLAYING THE WAITING GAME FOR YOUR OWN MONEY.

text: Fast and convenient

resp.text:
Jeanette,
We’re thrilled you enjoyed our 'fast and convenient' service, we like making our members happy at Alabama Credit Union! We also offer a great mobile app that can make managing your account even more convenient and fast -- but we would still love to see you in our branch. -- Alabama Credit Union
